name: Asara Wine Estate & Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful and gracious hotel/wine estate that is in the heart of the Stellenbosch wine area. We loved the setting and the proximity to other numerous wineries, plus the delightful town of Stellenbosch. The staff really makes Asar a unique experience. The restaurant is excellent and complimented with some really good Asara wines. We will certainly be back!!
reviews.title: Great gateway to Stellenbosch wine area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a beautiful landscape, among vineyards, olive trees and a lake, between the mountains... the room is extremely comfortable and romantic. Breakfast is excellent and the hotel still has a restaurant, a bar, a delli and, of course, the winery with wine tasting. I definetly recommend this hotel, especially for couples.
reviews.title: Sleeping in a wine estate in Stellenbosch
Wonderful, but would have loved to stay one more night
reviews.text: Everything was perfect with great value for money and friendly service. We were upgraded to a classic room and tried to book a second night. We were informed that we could stay an extra night, but that we would have to pay full rate for a classic room. We then requested to move to a courtyard room, but none were available....would have been nice if the hotel could have accommodated us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Asara in Stellenbosch. The hotel is beautiful and is located in a stunning scenery. The rooms were very large and luxurious for the price we paid. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was sumptuous. I recommend staying here wholeheartedly!
reviews.title: Top hotel, winery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for a lovely stay at Asara! My husband and I spend only one night, but it felt like a week. From the moment you step inside the staff is very kind and helpful. Rooms are spacious and clean and we had a wonderful view on the mountains.
reviews.title: ONE WORD: WONDERFUL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at Asara and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly and our room was spacious with a great bathroom and underfloor heating which really takes the winter chills away. The only thing I would recommend is to put a dressing table/desk in the room. As much as we hate working over holidays and using the hairdryer, sometimes it is necessary and the lack of a proper dressing table/desk area and insufficient plugs was problematic, moving tables and trying to reach down to plug equipment in. The restaurant was fabulous with great dinner, stunning breakfasts except for the last day, when the breakfast buffet was cancelled. The views are stunning and the service as really good.
reviews.title: Stunning Stay in Stellenbosch

reviews.text: We went to asara for a few nights during our honeymoon and we were very impressed. The estate is beautiful, the scenery and landscape are breathtaking and the rooms and staff are lovely. The place is really picturesque and relaxed and we thought the restaurant was quite nice too. Overall a super place to stay and really romantic for a couples getaway.
reviews.title: Beautiful place for a honeymoon

reviews.text: On arrival my partner and I were given a free upgrade, we had a truly wonderful stay. Beautiful location, gorgeous rooms and good value for money. Would definitely recommend it. Get bitterballen in the bar - so good!
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just relax and enjoy your stay there!
reviews.title: Best experience in Stellembosch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been told to stay one day in a winery... and that's a great advice, because you can try their wines and go to your bed!
reviews.title: Beautiful property, huge and nice rooms

reviews.text: We arrived in the dark after a long drive not really knowing a great deal about Asara. We had booked at short notice on the web after an early departure from another location. However, the site of the entrance lodge and the long drive passing through manicured rows of trees, roses and wines soon relaxed us. For such a large estate and hotel it contains relatively few guest rooms. The reason for this is the generous size of the rooms and en suite bathrooms, all of which have private balconies and are very comfortable and well equipped. The entire estate and hotel is immaculate and the staff welcoming and professional. The food is outstanding with the option of also drinking the estate's own wines although they do have the options of an extensive list of other wines.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: The cellar tour and wine tasting should be on the list of things to do for all guests.
reviews.title: First Contact at Restaurant

reviews.text: I was impressed by the quality of the hotel, food and wines and as a visitor from the overpriced UK, astounded by the outstanding value for money.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friends recommended the view and tranquillity. They did complain that I was quite pricey, not really value for money, but we were willing to give it a try. However, as we went there to have lunch on Sunday, as we entered the Restaurant area the concierge gave us a foul look as if the cat dragged us in. Not professional at all, will not recommend friends. There are better places to dine and at a better prices as well.
reviews.title: A fantastic place to stay in Stellenbosch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed in this beautiful spot.You can stay here for 2 nights and feel as if you've been there for a week. Very relaxing, delicious food, lovely comfortable rooms, beautiful views.
reviews.title: You Could Want Nothing More!

reviews.text: If I was grading Asara purely on location and quality of food etc it would receive a very good rating, of course my review combines these aspects with others and therefore my overall result ends up being one of gross disappointment and shock.
reviews.title: Honeymoon from HELL

reviews.text: Asara is situated in a gorgeous part of the Winelands and commands spectacular views, the food is wonderful and the rooms are generally very good but this is where the positives stop, the rest is nothing but downhill traffic. The supposed 5* grading is destroyed by a lackluster Senior Management team that seems to have very little regard for their guests, especially when problems occur. I suppose the in-house slogan “Always our Pleasure” doesn’t apply in this case, does it ever?
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 3 rooms in October 2012 as part of our Honeymoon trip which included 2 rooms for our relatives from the US, among them an elderly couple in their 80’s. Having splurged on the Bell Tower Suite for my wife and me, I had high expectations for a gorgeous 3 night stay. We checked in upon arriving and were shown to our rooms without too much enthusiasm from the staff, except when it came to providing a tip. The general rooms are decently appointed and comfortable although not more so than most other 3 and 4* properties in the area. The Bell Tower Suite is set on 3 levels and ends up being quite difficult to get around in, the bathroom is up a spiral staircase and overlooks the parking lot whilst the lounge is on the lowest level and overlooks the reception, not a 5* view from any part of the room. Interestingly too, there is no “spy keyhole” in the door of this suite and apparently no security cameras in the passage leading to this room. If you are looking to book a suite here, book another one.
reviews.title: Second visit - just as good as the first

reviews.text: Im not sure if the staff even know of the lower level lounge as our bottle of Champagne and dirty glasses from the first night remained downstairs for 2 days, any decent 3* hotel would have got that right. I could mention a number of incidents that occurred such as room service orders that were never delivered, wake up calls 3 hours early at 03:45am, bathrooms that weren’t serviced daily and the dirty glasses left in the room. Other small details were annoying such as the welcome letter addressed only to me with no mention of “Mrs”, on a Honeymoon this is an important aspect from a guest satisfaction perspective, especially as my “Mrs” felt fairly left out, understandably so.
reviews.title: It does not get any better than this.

reviews.text: My main gripe with this establishment however is the absolute lack of respect and service that arose after a theft at the hotel. The resident Security Manager Chris Bruyns attended to us promptly after we noticed this incident, he also sought the involvement of the Police the same day and seemed fairly efficient in his doings. I have no negative complaints in respect to his handling of the situation, in fact he was the most helpful staff member at Asara.
reviews.title: Very nice. Perhaps not perfect but very very good.

description: Asara Wine Estate & Hotel offers five-star luxuries in the heart of the vineyards. With the luxury hotel, two restaurants, cigar & whiskey lounge, grand ball room for events as well as a range of award winning wines available for tasting - there is certainly something to satisfy a variety of tastes.
